verses.text: 使徒的權利我不是自由的嗎？我不是使徒嗎？我不是見過我們的主耶穌嗎？你們不是我在主裡面的工作嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'

verses.text: 對別人來說，我或許不是使徒，但對你們來說，我總是使徒，因為你們就是我在主裡作使徒的印記。

words.note: Used to introduce a viewpoint or context.
Emphasizes the following statement.
Often used as a locative suffix with '在'.
Refers to a sign of authenticity or ownership.

verses.text: 對那些盤問我的人，這就是我的答辯。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun modifier.

verses.text: 難道我們沒有權利吃喝嗎？

words.note: Used to ask rhetorical questions, implying the answer is obvious.

verses.text: 難道我們沒有權利，像其餘的使徒、主的弟兄和磯法一樣，帶著信主的妻子往來嗎？

words.note: Often used for 'brothers in Christ' in a religious context.
Indicates ongoing action or state.
Verb-object compound, specific to Christian faith.
In this context, implies 'traveling around with them'.

verses.text: 難道只有我和巴拿巴沒有權利不作工嗎？

words.definition: could it be that; do you mean to say
words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question, often implying the answer is no.

verses.text: 有誰當兵要自備糧餉呢？有誰栽種葡萄園，不吃園裡的果子呢？有誰牧養羊群，不喝羊的奶呢？

words.note: Refers to military provisions and pay.
Literally 'grape garden'.

verses.text: 我說這話，不是照著人的意見，律法不也是這樣說嗎？
就在摩西的律法上記著說：「牛踹穀的時候，不可籠住牠的嘴。」難道 神關心的只是牛嗎？

words.definition: could it be that, do you mean to say
words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question, often implying the answer is no.
Capitalized as a proper noun referring to the Creator.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause: 'that which God cares about'.

verses.text: 這不全是為我們說的嗎？當然是為我們說的，因為耕種的應當存著希望去耕種，收割的也應當存著希望去分享收穫。

words.note: Forms a modifying clause 'that which is said for us'.
Forms a modifying clause 'that which is said for us'.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who cultivate'.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who harvest'.

verses.text: 我們既然在你們中間撒了屬靈的種子，如果要從你們那裡收穫一些物質的供應，這算是過分嗎？
如果別人在你們身上享有這種權利，我們不是更可以享有嗎？然而我們沒有用過這種權利，反而凡事容忍，免得我們攔阻了基督的福音。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 所作的一切都是為了福音難道你們不知道，在聖殿供職的，就吃殿中的供物；侍候祭壇的，就分領壇上的祭物嗎？

words.note: Used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
Refers to those engaged in sacred service.
Implies receiving a divided share.

verses.text: 主也曾這樣吩咐，叫傳福音的人靠福音為生。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Refers to evangelists or ministers.
Lit. 'blessed news'
An idiomatic verb-object phrase meaning 'to live by'.

verses.text: 但這種權利，我一點也沒有用過。我寫這些話，並不是想叫人這樣待我，因為我寧可死，也不讓人使我所誇耀的落了空。

words.definition: not at all, not in the least
words.note: An idiomatic phrase expressing complete negation.

words.definition: it is certainly not, definitely not

words.note: Refers to the object or content of one's boasting.

words.definition: to fall empty, be made void
words.note: An idiomatic phrase meaning 'to come to nothing'.

verses.text: 我傳福音原是沒有可誇的，因我不能不傳。如果不傳福音，我就有禍了。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
Indicates something worth boasting about.
Double negative meaning 'must'.
Lit. 'blessed news'
Often implies divine judgment or misfortune in religious texts.

verses.text: 如果我甘心作這事，就有賞賜；即使不甘心，這職責還是託付我了。

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior or God.

verses.text: 那麼，我的賞賜是甚麼呢？就是我傳福音時，叫人免費得著福音。這樣，我就沒有用過傳福音可以享有的權利了。

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior or God.
Lit. 'blessed news'
Lit. 'blessed news'
Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 我雖然自由，不受任何人管轄，但我自願成為眾人的奴僕，為的是要多得一些人。

words.note: Common biblical term for a bond-servant of God/Christ.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of
to want, to be going to

verses.text: 對猶太人，我就作猶太人，為了要得著猶太人；對律法以下的人，雖然我自己不在律法之下，還是作了律法以下的人，為了要得著律法以下的人。

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Refers often to Mosaic Law in biblical contexts.
Refers often to Mosaic Law in biblical contexts.
Literary way to say 'under'.
Refers often to Mosaic Law in biblical contexts.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Refers often to Mosaic Law in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 對沒有律法的人，我就作了沒有律法的人，其實我不是在 神的律法以外，而是在基督的律法之下，為了要得著沒有律法的人。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.
Functions as a postposition.
Functions as a postposition.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

verses.text: 對軟弱的人，我就成了軟弱的人，為了要得著軟弱的人。對怎麼樣的人，我就作怎麼樣的人；無論如何，總要救一些人。

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of
in any case, no matter what

verses.text: 我所作的一切，都是為了福音的緣故，好讓我與別人同享福音的好處。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which I do'.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 難道你們不知道，在場上賽跑的人，雖然大家都跑，但得獎的只有一個人嗎？你們都應當這樣跑，好叫你們可以得獎。

words.note: Used to ask rhetorical questions, expecting a negative answer.

verses.text: 凡參加運動比賽的，在一切事上都有節制；他們這樣作，不過要得到能壞的冠冕，我們卻是要得不朽的冠冕。

words.note: Used to generalize, 'whoever', 'all who'.
Often used to mean 'in terms of things/matters'.

verses.text: 所以我奔跑，不是沒有目標的；我鬥拳，不是打空氣的。

words.note: Refers to boxing or fighting, specifically with fists.

words.definition: hit the air, box at nothing
words.note: Idiomatic expression meaning effort without purpose or effect.

verses.text: 我要克制自己的身體，叫身體服我，免得我傳了給別人，自己反而落選了。

words.note: Indicates preventing an undesirable outcome.
Here, '傳' implies preaching the gospel.

words.definition: be disqualified, fail to be chosen
words.note: In a spiritual sense, refers to failing God's approval or salvation.
